articles.title: Donald Trump faces skeptical court in New York fraud appeal
articles.description: A New York appeals court on Tuesday signaled it was unlikely to grant Donald Trump's request to dismiss state Attorney General Letitia James' civil lawsuit accusing him, his family business and three of his children of a "staggering" fraud. The Appellate Division in Manhattan was considering Trump's appeal from a January lower court ruling allowing James to sue.

articles.title: US trial for exiled Chinese businessman Guo Wengui set for April 2024
articles.description: Guo is a prominent critic of China's Communist Party, and business associate of former U.S. President Donald Trump's onetime adviser Steve Bannon. He has been jailed since his March arrest, when prosecutors accused him of defrauding thousands of followers by promising "outsized" investment returns, and diverting much of their money to fund lavish lifestyles for himself and his family.
articles.content:
